description: This function takes a list of taxa and matches them to the OpenTree of life taxonomy. It then matches these taxa to the TimeTree of Life using taxonomy, and swaps out as many exchangeable taxa as possible using the Phyndr algorithm to obtain a time-calibrated phylogeny with maximal overlap with the original taxa list.

inputs.description: A data table with a column containing species names to match to the TTOL
inputs.name: table

inputs.description: The column of the data table containing species names
inputs.name: column

inputs.description: A string of comma separated values that give the time slices for building a taxonomy in MYBP. All numbers must be between 2040 and 0.
inputs.name: times

inputs.description: The number of cores to use for querying OpenTree of life Taxonomic Name Resolution Service
inputs.name: ncores

name: TreeTimerBobConvert2

outputs.description: A table providing the TNRS results from OpenTree. Should be checked to determine if the correct taxa were matched to the OpenTree Taxonomy.
outputs.name: OpenTree TNRS Table

outputs.description: newick version of time tree as a string
outputs.name: string.tree

script:
require(treetimer)
require(cardoonTools)

## # Load data from the timetree of life
## All the different subsets in the future. For now:
data(ttolData)

if(is.null(dim(table))){
 taxalist <- table
 } else {
 taxalist <- table[,column]
}

timeslices <- sort(as.numeric(gsub(" ", "", strsplit(times, ",")[[1]])), decreasing=TRUE)
ttPhynd <- treetimer:::phyndrTTOL(ttolData, taxalist, timeslices, prune=TRUE, ncores=ncores)
newTimetree <- phyndr::phyndr_sample(ttPhynd$phyndr)

plotfn <- function() {
    plot(newTimetree, label.offset = 50, y.lim = c(-1, length(newTimetree$tip.label)))
    TH <- max(branching.times(newTimetree))
    seq1 <- seq(TH,0, length.out=5)
    axis(1, rev(signif(seq1, 2)), labels=signif(seq1,2), lwd=1)
    }
    
ottTNRS <- ttPhynd$otts
    
treePlot <- cardoonPlot(expression(plotfn()), width=1000, height=1000, res=100)
treePlot <- treePlot$png
    

#BobConvert
string.tree<-write.tree(newTimetree)
